arm_group.description: Psychoeducational program consisted of (1) two inpatient sessions of face-to-face education on stroke and its caregiving; (2) six biweekly problem-solving training via telephone contacts after the discharge of stroke survivors

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a randomized controlled trial with a 3-month psychoeducational program as
      intervention, followed by a 3 month observational period. The purpose of this study was to
      examine whether a psychoeducational program focusing on equipping caregivers with
      problem-solving skills would improve caregiver's problem-solving abilities, their
      psychological responses and caregiving resources, and would minimize the use of health and
      social services among stroke survivors.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Psychoeducational Intervention for Stroke Family Caregivers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria (caregiver):

          -  Family member of stroke survivor

          -  Chinese adult

          -  Live with stroke survivors

          -  Primary caregiver

          -  Being able to communicate with the researcher

        Inclusion Criteria (stroke survivor):

          -  Chinese adult with diagnosis of stroke

          -  Live at home after discharge

          -  Being able to understand and to give consent

        Exclusion Criteria (caregiver and stroke survivor):

          -  History of self-reported doctor-diagnosed psychiatric illness

          -  (stroke survivor): being mild to totally independent

facility.name: Prince of Wales Hospital, Shatin Hospital, Tai Po Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of a Psychoeducational Intervention on Stroke Family Caregiver Outcomes and the Use of Health and Social Services Among Stroke Survivors: A Randomized Controlled Trial

overall_official.affiliation: Nethersole School of Nursing, Chinese University of Hong Kong

oversight_info.authority: Hong Kong: Joint CUHK-NTEC Clinical Research Ethics Committee

primary_outcome.description: Change in self-appraised problem-solving abilities, as measured by the Problem Solving Inventory (Chinese version), will be analyzed using the Generalized Estimating Equations (GEE) model
primary_outcome.measure: Caregiver's change in self-appraised problem-solving abilities from baseline

primary_outcome.description: Change in depressive symptoms severity, as measured by the 10-item Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression (Chinese version), will be analyzed by the GEE model
primary_outcome.measure: Caregivers' change in depressive symptom severity from baseline

primary_outcome.description: Change in perceived mental health, as measured by the Chinese (Hong Kong) Medical Outcomes Study 12-item Short Form Health Survey version 2 (SF-12v2), its mental component summary score will be analyzed by the GEE model
primary_outcome.measure: Caregiver's change in perceived mental health from baseline

primary_outcome.description: End-point between-group differences of the caregiving burden, as measured by the Caregiving Strain Index (Chinese version),  will be analyzed by the independent t test.
Change in caregiving competence, as measured by the Caregiving Competence Scale (Chinese version), will be analyzed by the GEE model
primary_outcome.measure: Caregiver's change in caregiving competence from baseline

responsible_party.investigator_title: PhD (Nursing) candidate, BN, PgD (Mental Health), RN

secondary_outcome.description: Change in family functioning, as measured by the McMaster Model of Family Assessment Device (Chinese version), will be analyzed using the GEE model
secondary_outcome.measure: Caregiver's change in family functioning from baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Change in perceived social support, as measured by the Six-item Social Support Questionnaire (Chinese version), will be analyzed using the GEE model
secondary_outcome.measure: Caregiver's change in perceived social support from baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Change in perceived physical health, as measured by the Chinese (Hong Kong) SF-12v2 (Physical Component Summary Score), will be analyzed by the GEE model
secondary_outcome.measure: Caregiver's change in perceived physical health from baseline

secondary_outcome.description: End-point between-group differences of the self-reported caregiving related injuries will be analyzed using Chi square statistics
End-point between-group differences of the self-reported stroke-related hospital readmission, such as falls, recurrent stroke, will be analyzed using Chi square statistics
End-point between-group differences of the placement to residential/nursing care home of stroke survivors will be analyzed by the Chi square statistics
secondary_outcome.measure: Placement to residential/nursing care home (stroke survivors)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
